decision_conditions: The proposal would not be permitted development due to the eaves height exceeding the maximum height allowed of 3m

The block plan submitted with the application conflicts with the information given on the application form and shows an extension of a cumulative depth that exceeds the limitations of development allowed under the prior approval process.

This written notice indicates that the proposed development would not comply with condition A.4 of Schedule 2 Part 1 Class A of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015.  It is important to note that this written notice does not indicate whether or not the proposed development would comply with any of the other limitations of conditions of Schedule 2 Part 1 Class A.
The applicant has the right to an appeal against this notice to the Planning Inspectorate, see details below.
description: Single storey rear extension with an overall depth of 6m, a maximum height of 3.5m and an eaves height of 3.5m (PRIOR APPROVAL)
